channel.title: INtopBackup
channel.description: This is a randomly ordered feed of the most recent entries from INtopBackup, skipping any feeds with errors.

item.title: Fed keeps interest rates steady. And, Catholics around the world wait for a new Pope
item.description: The Federal Reserve held interest rates steady amid uncertainty over President Trump's trade war. And, the Trump administration has plans to deport mi...

item.title: Medicaid payments barely keep hospital mental health units afloat. Federal cuts could sink them
item.description: Patients seeking mental health care are more likely to be on Medicaid than patients in more profitable areas of care, such as cancer or cardiac treatm...

item.title: No new pope elected yet after black smoke pours out of Sistine Chapel's chimney
item.description: Black smoke streamed from the chimney of the Sistine Chapel on Thursday morning in Rome, signaling that the 133 cardinal electors have not come to a t...

item.title: Americans are already seeing Trump's tariffs kick in. They sent in receipts to prove it
item.description: There's new tariffs on almost everything that is imported. Some of that increased cost is being eaten by exporters in other countries, but a lot of th...

item.title: How one writer quit dieting and discovered her strength through weightlifting
item.description: Casey Johnston spent years running and restricting calories. When she started weightlifting, she rebuilt muscle mass — and her relationship with her b...

item.title: Dozens of pro-Palestinian protesters arrested at Columbia University
item.description: The university asked for police help after protesters occupied part of the main library on Wednesday.

item.title: Civil rights leaders say acquittals in Tyre Nichols’ death highlight the need for police reform
Israel PM 'uncertain' over condition of three Gaza hostages
item.description: Benjamin Netanyahu said he knew "with certainty" that 21 hostages were alive but the status of "three more" were unclear.

item.title: Watch Live: Trump unveiling U.S.-U.K. trade deal today
item.description: President Trump posted on social media that it "should be a very big and exciting day for the United States of America and the United Kingdom."

item.title: Ukraine labels Russian ceasefire a farce after reports of hundreds of violations
item.description: A three-day truce was called by Vladimir Putin ahead of Russia's World War Two Victory Day celebrations.

item.title: Watch: Moments past conclaves elected new popes
item.description: See the moments previous popes were elected by conclaves past, from 1939 to 2013.

item.title: Real ID requirement kicks in today at airports across U.S.
item.description: Wednesday marks the first day U.S. travelers flying domestically will be required to show a Real ID at airports.

item.title: Putin lets U.S. media in for Victory Day as U.S.-Russia relations thaw
item.description: As Russia celebrates its 80-year-old victory over Nazi Germany, Putin wants the world to see that despite the new conflict in Europe, he still has fri...

item.title: Smokey Robinson’s lawyer says rape allegations against him are ‘vile’ and ‘false’
Deadly April rainfall in US South and Midwest was intensified by climate change, scientists say
item.description: Human-caused climate change intensified deadly rainfall in Kentucky, Tennessee, Arkansas and other states in early April and made it more likely to oc...

item.title: Should you use inheritance to pay off credit card debt?
item.description: Before you pay off credit card debt with money from an inheritance, there are factors you should consider first.

item.title: House approves bill renaming Gulf of Mexico as "Gulf of America"
item.description: The bill would codify the name change, though it would carry no authority outside the U.S.

item.title: US judge blocks plan to deport migrants to Libya
item.description: The order comes after lawyers expressed alarm that the US was planning to deport migrants to the North African country "immediately".
